Description: Unique equation identification number given arbitrarely. Links to Site_Species table.
Algebraic form of the biomass equation as function of DBH
Equation to calculate biomass (includes coeficients given in original publication)
Tree component characterized by the equation
Parameters included in biomass model (H: tree height (m); DBH: diameter breast heigh (1.3 m); DBA: diameter at base; WD: wood density)
Specific taxonomic level for which the equation was developed (species, genus, family or plant group)
Species used as proxy to calculate AGB when a specific-species equation was not available
Geographic location from which trees were sampled to develop the original equation
Minimun DBH in cm sampled to develop the equation
Maximun DBH in cm sampled to develop the equation
Number of trees sampled to develop the equation
DBH unit used in original publication
Mass unit used in original publication

Method used to develop the allometry. Traditionally, this is done by harvesting whole trees, drying, and weighing ("harvest").  However, we anticipate that many future allometries will be developed using ground-based LiDAR ("lidar").
Regression model used in original publication
Comparable models if reported in publication (given equation form)
Whether the regretion fit is done with biomass as the response variable (i.e log(biomass) base 10)
Indicates if a correction factor (CF) or a relative standard error (RSE) was included in model
Correction factor for the specific equation, pulled from original publication, if included
Other details on statistical methods
Indicates whether or not the original source data is available
Includes any notes to consider when using selected equation
Warning or error message to indicate any pitfall that could spoil the AGB estimate based on equation selected
Unique reference identification number for biomass equation source. Links to Reference table.
